intro: Castilleja densiflora, commonly known as the denseflower stickseed, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has reduced leaves and relies on other plants for some of its nutrients, making it a hemiparasite. It typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. Its unique botanical features make it an important component of its ecosystem.
